rComments: Professor Kamehiro is an amazing woman. She is so incredibly enthusiastic about the material, and instills that enthusiasm in her students. I took this class as a sort of credit filler, and that was a mistake. She expects the best out of her students, and you should undoubtedly spend a lot of time preparing for her exams.

Stacy was a fun professor! Her lectures were interesting and easy to follow. She made it clear what she wanted out of the essay prompts too. If you take this class, my biggest tip is to go to section! They were extremely beneficial for breaking apart the prompts and getting prepared for the exams. Great teacher, highly recommend.

500+pgs of detailed reading to do to pass. Stacy's lectures are summaries of the readings. There are 3 essay exams and 4 prompts for EACH. TA's are tough graders and will only accept very specific responses for an A. Basically you have to be able to regurgitate everything+more from the readings in your 1hr essay exam. DO NOT TAKE AS A GE.

Stacey is sweet but section should not be mandatory for this class. However, she makes finals easy but in a way that she tries to make you actually learn the material she teaches. Go to class, take notes and do the practice questions. How you do on the essays/tests completely depends on the TA you get though, and they grade hard for no reason.
She's a really amazing teacher. Here level of expertise oh the subject at hand really makes her class interesting.

Although the subject matter is beautiful, lectures are pretty boring and not engaging. Readings are not as interesting as the subject. midterm, final, and a paper. Difficult to get a solid A but easy class to pass.

Stacy is a great professor! I really enjoyed her class. She is very clear and informative and very helpful. She is approachable too and makes the subject interesting. The readings are not as difficult as other classes I've had, and I guess you have to be actually interested in the history of art to appreciate and understand her classes.

Stacy was alright. Her class had hit and miss days. I felt like she had many slow paced lectures, and then giant stressful cramming lectures before midterms or finals. Shes a nice person and a passionate teacher, but she's definitely teaching to students that are HAVC majors. Its not an ideal GE. Also, TA's expect VERY specific things on the essays

I thought she was great. The reader was relevant to the lectures and vice versa, which made the essay tests easy. It was long since it was on Tues/Thurs, but did enjoy it and learned a lot. It was a HAVC class, but covered tons of ground in the areas of religion and the social structures of the groups we studied. I recommend this class!

Felt like a high school class. Essay format was ridiculous, pretty much had to write exactly what the TA said to write from the review sessions. I'm not really bitter about my grade, a B is fine for a class I spent 5hrs/week on, I just hate it when Professors and TA's dumb classes down to a point where no original thought is welcome.

Kamehiro is an excellent teacher, makes seemingly boring/random subject very interesting, her lectures are informative/thorough. 3 in-class essays are very hard though, she expects you to give detailed info for each, but do-able if you prepare the notecards that she lets you bring, and use readings. She's very helpful if you go to her office hours.

Great class and teacher. If you attend lectures, prepare for exams and at least attempt to read the reader, you will do well. Information can be bland sometimes, but it's an interesting topic over all. No discussions, so that's nice.
Nicest person ever! I love Stacy, she wants everyone to do well in her classes. No tests in this class, but there are reading response essays and a research paper with a presentation at the end.

I really enjoyed her AOA (Africa, Oceania, Americas) class and would recommend her to anyone who wants to take a relatively easy and interesting GE. Stacy was clearly knowledgeable and enthusiastic about her work, and I felt like I learned a fair amount from her, even at 8 in the morning. Take her if possible!

Stacy is an amazing teacher! She made the lecture interesting and made me want to attend even though it was at 8 in the morning. I took this class just to fill my schedule and Im definitely glad i did. She gives you a notecard for the tests and the essay questions. It also offers a bunch of GEs, just an added bonus. TAKE HER CLASS

Great teacher! Made lectures fun and interesting, very easily approachable. Very helpful and encouraging, good with e-mail responses. There was a fair amount of reading, but definetly managable, and if you were well prepared and showed up to classes, the mindterms/final were easy to pass. If I could I would have her as my professor every quarter! :

Boring course material. 3 in class essays (she gives you 3 questions each time, chooses 1 when you show up to write it, and it's always the one you hope she doesn't pick). Seems easy, but TA seems to grade unfairly. Lots of listening early in am, little pay-off. Would prefer a multiple choice exam.
Stacy is a wonderful passionate teacher! Took history of body art in the oceania with her and her AND her TAs made the 8am class bearable and interesting

Kamehiro is very sweet and easy to understand. Her syllabus and rubric is very laid out and simple. She tells you exactly what you need to know for the exams. She gives out 3-4 essay exam questions before hand and chooses one for the exam. If you pack everything in the provided 3x5 and attend class, easy A.

Very organized and passionate about what she's teaching. The only "book" we needed was the class reader. The midterm and final seemed overwhelming because of all of the facts we needed to memorize, but as long as you start studying a week prior you should be fine. She's also a very sweet professor!

Stacy is a very knowledgeable professor. She has interesting lectures and teaches well. Sections are different, though. If she keeps the same TA's, try to avoid Eben. Find another one instead. Eben is incredibly rude and inconsiderate.

shes darling, like a cute mom. shes loves what she teaches and has a lot of knowledge of art. i took oceania art and if you study her handouts and attend lecture from time to time then you will do fine.

Stacy is passionate and very, very knowledgeable on her subject.  She hardly has to look at her notes.  She is also a lovely person.  Her assignments are rather disorganized, however, and the TAs in this class were very uninformed.

Way easy lectures, you just have to attened since she has sign in sheets.  Paper was cake, and disscusions are VERY relaxed.  I took marginal notes and did fairly well in the tests, you have to memorize slides which is a bummer but it's art history.
I found stacy a wonderful teacher. Passionate about what she teaches and knowledgeable in her subject. Her readings correlated to her lectures. Overall I loved her class.

I took Pacific Island Body Art with Stacy, and it was terrible.  She wouldnt use a mic in lecture and was really unclear.  Her assignments were really long and not organized.  She was not helpful when i asked her questions, just unorganized! boo to her!

Such an interesting topic, but the long readings, stuck up TAs and super hard tests --that are all memorizing detailed info you'll forget right after the exam--make this class less enjoyable. If you like HAVC already go ahead and take it, but seriously memorizing dates and strange names, locations,and titles of 60 images is stupid and stressful!

Kamehiro is adorable. That said, she is also very passionate about her topic and it has helped me get interested in what she's saying even at 9:30 in the morning. This class is one of my favorite classes I've taken so far (I'm a sophmore) and I almost wish I was a HAVC major just so I could see more of Kamehiro.
Very well orgainized but put me to sleep. Really interesting topic but I wish she was a little more engaging. Make sure you read all the readings assigned for the exams.
She is amazing. Great teacher, and I'm so glad I got to know her before I graduated. TAKE ALL HER CLASSES! Her lectures might be a bit slow, but seminars are the best!
I withdrew from the class because her lecture style put me to sleep. Completely uncaptivating, and assignment instructions are very unclear.

Stacy is absolutely fantastic. She was always easy to understand, and friendly. If you have a question, she will always try her best to answer it and if she has no idea about it, she'll  be upfront and tell you that.

Wonderfully organized, sweet and motherly, solid lecturer. I'm in shock at how much I learned about Art of Oceania -- something I knew nothing about beforehand. Will definitely be taking another class with Stacy!

Interesting, interested, engaging. She was always very clear about what was to be on the final, and very precise about the projects. She was able to explain the topics very explicitly. Most straightforward class I've taken so far.

Really interesting class.  Only HAVC class I have taken, and it had a lot of history and anthropology in it, which was very nice.  She is really nice and helpful if you see her outside of class.  Midterms and Final are tough, but you get a cheat sheet.  Grading was tough but fair, she laid out exactly what she wanted you to do.  Overall good class.
Very nice, very clear, and very interesting. You can use a notecard on each midterm (2) and final. These are essays and you have to study a good amount of time to get a good grade.

Very helpful. Trouble is, the class satisfies several GEs, so most people I know who take it are undergrads NOT in a related field. To truly find this class easy, you MUST have prior experience in art interpretation. Do NOT take this class if you don't, unless you're willing to work long hours for a B. Highly recommended for art or VC majors.

Stacy is so sweet and kind.  She prepares you very well for all the assignment and tests.  Yes, the lectures can be a bit boring but nothing too bad.  I found the class to be interesting and I would recomment it.

this class was unbelievably boring. Huge workload. The work was not hard, but very tedious. Mucho research for the research paper, but she gives you a list of books to look at on reserve. Midterms were a pain.

Don't be fooled by the interesting name, this class is BORING! I fell asleep in almost every lecture and sections were a waste of time. The exams were pretty difficult, they took forever (5-10 pages of writing), and the TAs were too hard on their grading. However, Stacy is a nice lady and she knows her subject well.
Stacey is super sweet in a momish kinda way.  All of her expectations are very clearly outlined in the reader so you know exactly what is expected of you.  Pretty easy class, kinda boring lectures.

she attracted a huge class by persuading them that it had to do with tatoos but tatoos where about 3% of the class. big workload. 10 pg midterm and final during a weekend and a 10 page research paper too. she also grades pointless things like outlines and research proposals. its a three GE class though, which is nice in the end.

Her lectures were interesting, but her choice in TAs ruined the class for me. She doesn't regulate how or what the TA teaches. She never emails back if you have questions about grading procedures. Her tests are extremely hard. We had one weekend to complete a 10pg midterm paper, and are expected to complete one just as hard in class for the final
Stacy is an excellent professor. she is down to earth and knows her studies. I learned many aspects of life i was never exposed to and enjoyed the learning environment she set up for us. ROjo
Stacy knew her subject matter well, I was impressed. You have to view and memorize a lot of images, but its interesting.
She's a good instructor and has a lot of knowledge about the topic and class.  However, alot of the work is tedious and i found it pointless.  Sections were pointless.
